t: Jeremiah 15
The Lord Will Not Relent
Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “Even*i if Moses and Samuel stood before Me, My mind would*i not be*i favorable toward this people. Cast them*i out of My sight, and let them go forth.

And it shall be, if they say to you, ‘Where should we go?’ then you shall tell them, ‘Thus says the Lord:*s “Such*pn as are*i for death, to death; And*ld such as are*i for the sword, to the sword; And*ld such as are*i for the famine, to the famine; And*ld such as are*i for the captivity, to the captivity.”’
“And*p I will appoint over them four forms of*i destruction,”*i says the Lord:*s “the sword to slay, the dogs to drag, the birds of the heavens and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
I will hand them over to trouble, to all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for what he did in Jerusalem.
“For*pn who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem? Or*ld who will bemoan you? Or*ld who will turn aside to ask how you are doing?
You*ld have forsaken Me,” says the Lord,*s “You*ld have gone backward. Therefore*ld I will stretch out My hand against you and destroy you; I*ld am weary of relenting!
And*ld I will winnow them with a winnowing fan in the gates of the land; I*ld will bereave them*i of children; I*ld will destroy My people, Since*ild they do not return from their ways.

Their*ld widows will be increased to Me more than the sand of the seas; I*ld will bring against them, Against*ld the mother of the young men, A*ld plunderer at noonday; I*ld will cause anguish and terror to fall on them suddenly.

“She*ln languishes who has borne seven; She*ld has breathed her last; Her*ld sun has gone down While*ld it*i was*i yet day; She*ld has been ashamed and confounded. And*ld the remnant of them I will deliver to the sword Before*ld their enemies,” says the Lord.*s
Jeremiah’s Dejection

Woe*pn is me, my mother, That*ld you have borne me, A*ld man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I*ld have neither lent for interest, Nor*ld have men lent to me for interest. Every*ld one of them curses me.
The*p Lord*s said: “Surely*pn it will be well with your remnant; Surely*ld I will cause the enemy to intercede with you In*ld the time of adversity and in the time of affliction.
Can*ld anyone break iron, The*ld northern iron and the bronze?
Your*ld wealth and your treasures I*ld will give as plunder without price, Because*ld of all your sins, Throughout*ld your territories.
And*ld I will make you*i cross over with your enemies Into*ld a land which*i you do not know; For*ld a fire is kindled in My anger, Which*ild shall burn upon you.”

O*ln Lord,*s You know; Remember*ld me and visit me, And*ld take vengeance for me on my persecutors. In*ld Your enduring patience, do not take me away. Know*ld that for Your sake I have suffered rebuke.
Your*ld words were found, and I ate them, And*ld Your word was to me the joy and rejoicing of my heart; For*ld I am called by Your name, O*ld Lord*s God of hosts.
I*ld did not sit in the assembly of the mockers, Nor*ld did I rejoice; I*ld sat alone because of Your hand, For*ld You have filled me with indignation.
Why*ld is my pain perpetual And*ld my wound incurable, Which*ild refuses to be healed? Will*ld You surely be to me like an unreliable stream, As*ild waters that*i fail?
The Lord Reassures Jeremiah

Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s “If*pn you return, Then*ld I will bring you back; You*ld shall stand before Me; If*ld you take out the precious from the vile, You*ld shall be as My mouth. Let*ld them return to you, But*ld you must not return to them.

And*ld I will make you to this people a fortified bronze wall; And*ld they will fight against you, But*ld they shall not prevail against you; For*ld I am*i with you to save you And*ld deliver you,” says the Lord.*s
“I*ld will deliver you from the hand of the wicked, And*ld I will redeem you from the grip of the terrible.”
